page.title: 03Urban Structure of Bexhill
page.content: The town today forms{three zones.} The first is the{Old Town,}located in the centre-north of our block. The oldest houses are from the 17th and 18th centuries, and are now either large dwellings or antique shops or restaurants where the atmosphere of the Old Town is a business attraction. The second is the{Victorian}area centred around the station and extending down to the seafront. It is comprised mostly of large 3 and 4 storey terraced housing used for commercial purposes in the centre with boarding houses and old peoples homes surrounding that. Hotels almost exclusively cover the seafront. The third is the{modern}area to the east and west of the Victorian area. Near the seafront buildings are multi-storey flats. Inland there are detached and semi-detached houses.
